  • We must add this directory to the system path so that it can find a symlink to my repository here
  • Import stuff
  • We will make plots from a subset of the data data here on the culture-plate machine
  • Build a ROC Curve (be patient, it takes a long time to grab the data) source
  • Plot The same ROC curve quickly by using the precomputed data outputed in the previous cell. These ploting functions are very dynamic. You can input file paths, data, precomputed values and more.
  • Put log scale version on the side source
  • Different formatting options availiable…
  • Bin data by some property in bins built from some characteristic source. The accumilator is a functional that computes a characteristic of the data source. Although we probably not need it as we will have stored most of the important characteristics in the final format. So likely the code will look a little simpler than this.
  • Plot the bins with some y_value source
  • Make histograms
  • Using the inputHandler class to make getting data easier source
  • Using this to find the confusion matrix for the classifier
  • And of course feel free to copy paste anything in the repository into your own notebooks so that you have more control over the plots. Also pull requests are encouraged… Cheers, Danny (dannyweitekamp@gmail.com)
